runs.comm: extra bounce this time and he slashes it just over first slip
this one kicks up and beats the batsman
turns it to short midwicket for a single
stays beside the line and drops it with soft hands to the off side
stays beside the line and taps it just wide of gully and sets off for a single
full outside off and driven straight to cover
down the leg side and wide called
short of a good length on middle and off, tapped off the back foot into the off side
pushed off the front foot towards mid-off for a well-run single
short of a good length outside off, moves away a hint, fishes for it, aiming to run it down to third man, misses
beaten, zipped away from a good length outside off, bowled at 131.6 kmph, tried to play at it off the back foot, missed
shortish outside off, moves back and opens the face to guide it wide of slip and third man for a couple of runs
banged in short on middle, goes for the pull, is struck on the chest, came onto him  a little too quickly, managed to squeeze a run on the off side
slower one bowled short and cutting away, tries to run it down to third man, misses
short of a good length on the off, jabs it wide of extra cover and they put the pressure on the fielder there, rushing for a single, causing a fumble
another quick run, dropped it in front of slip and raced through for another single
on middle and off, tries to force it hard through the leg side, gets an inside edge onto his pads, another run to the total as it rolls in front of midwicket
nicely placed, short of a length on the off, makes room and he cuts it hard between point and cover to the ropes
shortish delivery down the leg side, tries to work it fine, doesn't make contact, given a wide
short of a good length on the off, punched off the back foot wide of extra cover

brilliantly taken, identical to his catch off Guptill yesterday, a superb delivery, landed on a good length on middle and moved away, tried to defend it on the front foot, the movement produced the outside edge and Kamran, stretched to his right to pluck it one-handed and tumbled to pull off a blinder
short and wide, tries to cut it hard through point, makes no contact
on middle and leg, gets forward and turns it towards midwicket
short of a good length on the off, taps it straight to extra cover off the back foot
full and wide outside off, falters off the final ball, gets forward and square-drives it hard over point for a boundary
hurls it on a good length on middle and leg, turned away wide of square leg for a single
Aamer was in the firing line, he's fortunate he made no contact with that, full on the off and he smashed it with utter contempt, just evaded Aamer and crashed into the fence
held it back and got it to move away after pitching, tried to run it down but was surprised by the extra bounce
bowled at 135.3 kmph, short of a good length on the off, defended to extra cover
full on the off, mistimes a drive wide of midwicket for a single
hurls it short on middle, gets behind it and taps it carefully back to the bowler
lands on a good length outside off, trying to induce him into playing the drive, he's not tempted
full and wide, in the slot and he tries to hammer it past the bowler but it moves away to beat the swing of the bat
short and wide, reaches to play the cut but can't meet it
moving away but he plays it well, defending it just wide of extra cover for a single
a full toss on the off, pushed it down towards mid-off for a single
lands on a good length on middle, worked it wide of mid-on for a single
slower one bowled short on the off, tries to upper-cut it past the keeper but can't get to it
short of a length outside off, guides it down to third man with an open face for a single
held it back, bowled it short on middle, rocked back and defended it to midwicket
gets some extra bounce there, short and wide, went for the cut but it zipped past him, no movement there but it shot off the pitch

a valiant attempt by Nazir at fine leg, short and he pulled it high behind square, Nazir moved to his right and tried to snap it with an outstretched right hand but couldn't hold on, the momentum would have taken him past the ropes anyway, palmed it over the ropes
short and wide, goes for the cut, mistimes it to cover
cheeky, waited for it to turn in and opened the face at the last moment to guide it wide of Afridi at short third man, earns a boundary first up
over the wicket now, bowls it on a good length on the off, turns in and he plays it back with a straight bat
turning in and he closes the face to play it to the right of Ajmal
fullish on middle and leg, turned away to midwicket
keeps it flat, bowls it at 88 kmph, works it away but straight to midwicket
shortish on the off, taps it behind point for a single to keep the strike
Guptill's not one of them, short of a length outside off, nipped back in a touch, tried to chop it down towards third man, got an inside edge onto the stumps
shortish on the off, gets across and drops it down back to the bowler
short of a good length outside off, cracks it wide of extra cover for a single to get off the mark
shortish on middle, works it away down to fine leg for a couple of runs
a fumble at point, short on the off, cuts it off the back foot and manages to get it into the deep as a result of a misfield
hurled it short on middle, played down gently from the crease behind square, ample time for them to run back for the second
flighted on middle and off, tucked away to the on side
stifled appeal, clips his pads outside the line of leg I would imagine, and rolls away
comes down the track, checks his shot and drives firmly to long-on
the doosra, pushes it down to mid-on
effortless! Flighted on the pads and he uses the bottom hand to good effect to send that rows over wide long-on, there was hardly a follow through on that shot
sweeps him forcefully to deep square leg
pushed away wide of point and rushes through for a quick single and they get another one on the overthrow
spun away sharply and had some extra bounce on it, leaving Taylor surprised and earning a dot ball
pushed off the front foot to extra cover and Gul fails to collect running forward, lets it through his fingers to allow them a single
on middle and off, turned away behind square, a poor throw from the deep but Gul backs it up, albeit a little awkwardly
hurled it quick and flat on the off and it's angling in, Taylor bends low and tries to execute his most favoured slog-sweep, misses and is caught plumb in front of middle and off
short of a good length on the off, just pushes it through the line to long-off, went on straight
hurls it down the leg side, and it spun down to beat Kamran as well as short fine, five wides, New Zealand needed it
gave it some air this time, clipped away through square leg for a single
bowled it straight, just a fraction outside off, guides it in front of point for a quick single
tossed it up outside off, driven down towards deep cover for one more
turned in from outside off, moved back and dropped it in front of short fine for a single
tossed up on the off, pushed through to long-on for a single
hurls it full on the off, drives it wide of Gul at long-off, enough time to run back for the second
spun away to beat him as he tried to nudge it behind point, Akmal fumbled it too
brilliantly fielded by Umar Akmal who threw himself to his right to pull off an excellent save but he couldn't prevent a single
curving it on middle and leg, tickled away towards deep square leg for a single
a brutal throw from Akmal who gathers it on the leg side and raps Afridi on the wrists, literally, there's no way he could have collected that, a wayward throw but no serious damage inflicted
a timely boundary, bowled it full on middle and he swept it fiercely to beat the diving deep square leg
fired it flat on middle, comes down the track and pushes it down to long-on for a single
threw it up, comes down the track and coverts it into a full toss, clips it through square leg into the deep and gets a couple to his name
the straighter one, slower through the air, he played for the spin and closed the face, it held its line, producing the leading edge but it lands safely wide of extra cover
pushed away off the front foot to midwicket
threw it up, bowled it full on middle, made a bit of room and smashed it over the bowler's head for a couple of bounces over the ropes
pitched it up on the off stump, driven back to the bowler
shortish outside off, moves towards it and slaps it down to long-off for a single
struck hard but just for a single, made room and cracked it down to deep extra cover
short of a length, using the spin to cut it past a diving point into the deep for a couple
goes for the sweep, mistimes it to deep square leg for a single

dropped, how costly will that prove? Bowled it short on middle, Imran Nazir had walked a few paces in at deep midwicket, Styris pulled it straight towards him, he tried to snap it over his head, couldn't hold on and palmed it off to the ropes
full on the off, driven hard but Umar Akmal does an excellent job at extra cover, sliding to his right to prevent the single
low full toss on the off, drilled down to long-off for a single
full and straight, on middle and leg, drives it down to long-on for a single
targeting the blockhole outside off, tries to drive it through cover, gets an inside edge just wide of the stumps for a single
full outside off, moves away and steers it down to third man for a couple more
hurls it on a good length on middle, at 135.7 kmph, ends up dragging it straight to midwicket, McCullum called for a single but Styris sent him back, much to his partner's dissatisfaction
cracks it on the bounce to long-off, full and wide and he doesn't get the desired elevation on it
short of a length on middle, comes down the track and chips it wide of long-on for a couple
shortish outside off, cuts it hard through point for a couple into the deep
rises up to him and it's the doosra, waits, sees it turn away and guides it behind point for a single
plenty of bounce on offer, turned in from a short of a good length outside off, Styris makes room to cut but it spits off the pitch and beats the edge
tries to fend it away into the leg side , clips the pads and they sneak a leg bye
goes for the pull but can't find the ropes, gets it on the bounce towards deep midwicket and gets back for the second
dispatches it into the stands! Short on the off and Styris swings it miles over the deep midwicket boundary, punished!
full and wide, makes room and slices it over extra cover, lands safe and they're back for a couple more
brilliant work by Afridi at extra cover who dives to his right and saves a few runs, returns a strong throw and would have found Styris short had he hit but didn't have much time to take aim
in the blockhole outside off, digs it out wide of point for a single
full on the off, driven straight to Afridi who's on the edge of the circle at extra cover, just the single
the paddle scoop is out, full on the off, moved well across, bent low and got it between the converging third man and fine leg for a valuable boundary
short on the off, turns in, goes for a big heave, mistimes it to deep square leg for a single
charges down the track, it's slower through the air, he had given it a bit of air to induce him into doing that, skied it and Malik, at long-on, judged it to perfection
driven off the front foot to long-off for a single
dot ball, he made room and he chased him with one that spun in sharply, got some bounce too and it went over the stumps as Styris missed
misses out, full toss on middle and leg, swings it straight to long leg for just a single
in the blockhole on middle, drills it on the bounce over Ajmal towards long-off for a well-run couple
was aiming for the blockhole but bowled it on a length, in the zone outside off, Styris makes a bit of room and clears long-off with one clean strike
hurls it full outside off, reaches but can't get under it, gets a single towards long-off

a wonderful low catch from Malik at long-on, lands on a length on leg stump, Franklin picks it but doesn't have enough wood on it, Malik running in from long-on, bends low and takes it inches off the ground.........Or so it seemed. The umpires are consulting. Franklin's still waiting, they're not sure if it carried, it appears they called for a referral but replays were inconclusive. The next batsman has already made his way in, and Franklin's waiting for the final call near the boundary line. He's been called back.
full outside off, driven straight to long-off for a single, just one run
misses out, low full toss on middle, ends up driving it straight to deep midwicket for a single

Malik snaps it at long-on, Styris made room and tried to launch that length delivery over long-on, found Malik at long-off who was waiting for that mistimed attempt and took it comfortably while preventing a collision with the man running in from long-on
